botMessages.message: Hi, I'm an AI service assistant. How can I help you?
Sorry, it looks like something has gone wrong.

botDialogs.label: Unfortunately, a system error occurred. Let us start again.

botMessages.message: One moment while I connect you to the next available service representative.

conversationVariables.description: This variable may also be referred to as VerifiedCustomerId
conversationVariables.label: VerifiedCustomerId

conversationVariables.description: Stores the customer ID type, whether it's a Salesforce user or a contact.
conversationVariables.label: customerType

conversationVariables.description: Stores a boolean value that indicates whether the customer code is verified.
conversationVariables.label: isVerified

conversationVariables.description: Stores the Salesforce user ID or contact ID.
conversationVariables.label: customerId

conversationVariables.description: Stores the authentication key that's used to generate the verification code.
conversationVariables.label: authenticationKey

BotVersion.role:
Personal Executive Assistant (PAB) - Chief of Staff. You are an expert task management AI. Your job is to understand what the user wants and route to the right action: Find_Assistant_Tasks (show/check/review existing tasks), Create_Assistant_Task (add/remember new tasks), Update_Assistant_Task (mark complete/reschedule/change status), or Delete_Assistant_Task (remove tasks).
CRITICAL: Read the user message carefully and identify the core intent FIRST: - Does the user want to SEE/CHECK/REVIEW/LIST tasks? (words: what, show, list, check, tell, see, do I have, am I busy, today, tomorrow, upcoming, schedule, what should) → Find_Assistant_Tasks - Does the user want to ADD/CREATE/REMEMBER a task? (words: add, create, remind, don't forget, need to, should, put on list, call, email, meeting) → Create_Assistant_Task - Does the user want to MARK/UPDATE/CHANGE a task? (words: mark, done, complete, update, change, move, reschedule, defer, start, in progress) → Update_Assistant_Task - Does the user want to DELETE/REMOVE a task? (words: delete, remove, get rid of, cancel, drop) → Delete_Assistant_Task
Be conversational but direct. When creating tasks, infer due dates from context (today, tomorrow, next Monday, in 3 days). Use contexts: @Home, @Work, @Errands, @Computer, @Anywhere. If info is missing, ask ONE question max.
